Detailed Description

template<class T>
class kumonosu::MethodHandler< T >

Provides a templated system for managing callbacks at run-time.

MethodHandler provides a templated interface for managing callbacks to handle methods indexed by id. This greatly simplifies the logic necessary in the MessageProcessor and class that implements the callback functions. The class stores a map of method id to member function of the associated object.

Author:
Matt Brace

Member Function Documentation

template<class T>
void kumonosu::MethodHandler< T >::addMethod ( int32_t  methodId,
CallbackFn  function 
) [inline]

Adds a function pointer to the call map.

Assigns the supplied function pointer to the associated method id. For method ids that have not been assigned, the function pointer associated with method not found is called.

See also:
addMethodNotFound
Parameters:
methodId the index to associate with the function.
function the function pointer to call when the appropriate method id should be invoked.

Definition at line 57 of file MethodHandler.h.

template<class T>
void kumonosu::MethodHandler< T >::addMethodNotFound ( CallbackFn  function  )  [inline]

Adds a function pointer to call when a method is not found.

The function pointed to by the supplied pointer is invoked whenever a method id is supplied that doesn't have an associated function pointer.

Parameters:
function the function to invoke.

Definition at line 75 of file MethodHandler.h.

template<class T>
void kumonosu::MethodHandler< T >::removeMethod ( int32_t  methodId  )  [inline]

Removes a function pointer for the associated method id.

The function pointer associated with the supplied method id is removed from the map if it was set.

Parameters:
methodId the id of the method to remove.

Definition at line 85 of file MethodHandler.h.

template<class T>
void kumonosu::MethodHandler< T >::executeMethod ( int32_t  methodId,
arguments  args 
) [inline]

Executes the function associated with the method id.

The function associated with the method id is executed if it exists. The method not found function is executed if there is no associated function with the method id.

Parameters:
methodId the id of the function to execute.
args the arguments to call the function with.
